name: Phantom Utilities
description: Common utility actions for phantom playbook use

actions.description: Tests connectivity to the Phantom REST API
Checks domain from given URL for presence in custom list

actions.verbose: Will update the fields specified in the Risk Score custom field and Related Events custom field. Assessment is performed based on tags applied to IOCs. Tag should provide a risk score for IOCs and should be prefixed with a static value as to make the easy to identify (e.g. risk_score-). Risk score is determined by looking at the highest scored IOC related to the container. Related Events finds the number of events with IOCs that match IOCs in event being assessed and are of the designated risk score threshold.

actions.description: Change encoding of text (e.g. utf-8, latin-1, etc.)
Gets a Phantom indicator record by value or ID
actions.verbose: If the "include artifact data" option is checked, the artifacts in which the indicator appears will be returned in the results. An ability to set an artifact limit is provided for use with commonly seen indicators. Use the sorting option to determine whether the artifacts returned are the newest of oldest.

actions.description: Parses URL into 6 components (scheme, netloc, path, params, query, fragment) using Python urlparse

actions.verbose:
Can be used with or without regex. If no regex, then just used to add text around existing string (i.e. create a query that uses a parameter from the existing datapath). If regex, findall is leveraged to find all specified groups. In either case, string format notation is used for modification (use {0} {1} {2}... etc for creating the new string).

If no regex and the output_string is 'I love {1}', and the string_to_format is 'Phantom', the resulting string is 'I love Phantom'.

The number parameter is the number on which the mathematic operation should be performed. The expression is the express to evaluate - use 'format string' style syntax. Example: number = 4; expression = '{0} * 4'; result would be 16 (4 * 4 = 16). For a complete list of supported operations please refer to py-expression-eval documentation.

actions.description: Splits a string based on delimiter and text qualifier (optional) in list of dictionaries
Converts a list to a list of of dictionaries objects
actions.verbose: List can be submitted as a python list or a string representation of a list.

To leverage today's date type 'now' in the date_value field'.

Only use date_format_input if absolutely necessary. In general, almost all types should be able to be parsed without needing to specify the format.

actions.description: Gets md5, sha1, and sha256 hash of given text
Collects artifact fields from multiple datapaths
actions.verbose: An example of when to use this - external IP data is in sourceAddress and destinationAddress and an IP reputation check is needed on both. Multi collect them into one field and then pass the resulting multi-collected field into Virus Total.
